group_1.textRight: Rabitan, what're you buying?

group_1.textLeft: Ingredients for dinner.@Seasonal vegetables and such...

group_1.textRight: Hmm.
Alright, you can go shopping like you normally do.
Mii's just gonna watch, snap some pics,@and ask questions once in a while!

group_1.textLeft: ...Then I will take your word and carry on@as I always do.
However, you did not need to accompany us,@Lady Nayuta...

group_1.textRight: It's lonely staying at home by myself...

group_1.textLeft: Welcome, Rabi!@I've got some good vegetables today too!

group_1.textRight: Good day. What would you recommend?

group_1.textLeft: The carrots are especially fresh!

group_1.textRight: Carrots, then...
And while you're at it...@Bell peppers and bean sprouts, please.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks as always!
Oh, right. About what you told me beforeãƒ¼
The customers who consulted with me about their@kitchen garden did just as you said,
and sure enough, the soil and vegetables all sprung@back to life. They were as happy as can be!

group_1.textRight: Ahh, the ones who came by the store earlier.@That couple...Mr. and Mrs. Akino, was it?
If they were satisfied, then I'm glad.

group_1.textLeft: And this here's a complimentary cabbage!
Rabi, you've been supporting me so much,
and all your stories of working in fields@and gardening have been a big help.

group_1.textRight: No, it was nothing...@Thank you very much.
Rabitan, you sure know a lot about gardening@and fields, don't ya!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, we have our own kitchen garden@and my grandfather has a field...

group_1.textRight: Your grandfather does...?@That's the first I've heard this.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, apologies, Mikage.

group_1.textRight: What's up?

group_1.textLeft: This has nothing to do with work, but do you mind@if we stop by the bookstore there?
They seem to be holding a clearance sale.

group_1.textRight: Sure, sounds good!@We'll be right behind you!

group_1.textLeft: ...I suppose this will do.

group_1.textRight: 1, 2, 3, 4 books...@Rabitan, you read lots of books?

group_1.textLeft: Yes, in between housekeeping and such.

group_1.textRight: Then you got a good deal out of this sale, huh!

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I'm really thankful for it.

group_1.textRight: Regardless, these are all high-level looking books...

group_1.textLeft: Are they...?
These are just a simple book on philosophy and a@historical novel... The rest are gardening related.

group_1.textRight: Are philosophy books interesting?
It's difficult to get my hands on thick books like these.@...Besides Papa's books I suppose.

group_1.textLeft: I love them.
Learning of various ways of thinking@is very interesting to me.

group_1.textRight: You think Mii can read them too?

group_1.textLeft: There are books for elementary schoolers, so@how about next time we go and look at the library?

group_1.textRight: Sure!
But Rabitan,@what got you into reading these kinds of books?

group_1.textLeft: Well you see...@Father is a bookworm...
And in times gone,@I would go into his study to read books...
So that may have been what influenced me.

group_1.textRight: Your father's...?

group_1.textLeft: That's enough about me.@Let's go to the next store.
